/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1959_Summer_Univ: The water polo event was contested at the 1959 Summer Universiade in Turin, Italy. Seven teams competed in the event with Yugoslavia winning the gold medal after winning all three of their matches in the final group.
/wiki/Yugoslavia_men%27s_national_water_: Yugoslavia men's national water polo team was the national water polo team that represented the Kingdom of Serbs, Croats and Slovenes (1920–1929), the Kingdom of Yugoslavia (1929–1941), the Federal People's Republic of Yugoslavia (1946–1963), the Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (1963–1992). They were one of strongest waterpolo teams in history of sport, having won 7 Olympic, 4 World Championship, 5 World Cup and 12 European Championship medals.
/wiki/Hungary_men%27s_national_water_pol: The Hungary men's national water polo team represents Hungary in international men's water polo competitions and is controlled by the Hungarian Water Polo Association. They are considered the world's top power in the history of water polo, having won 15 Olympic, 11 World Championship, 10 FINA World Cup , 8 FINA World League, 24 European Championship and 16 Summer Universiade medals in total of 84.
/wiki/Italy_men%27s_national_water_polo_: The Italian national water polo team represents Italy in men's international water polo competitions and is controlled by Federnuoto (the Italian Aquatics Federation). The national men's team has the nickname of "Settebello".
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1961_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1961 Summer Universiade in Sofia, Bulgaria.
/wiki/Soviet_Union_men%27s_national_wate: The Soviet Union men's national water polo team represented the Soviet Union in international water polo competitions. After the dissolution of the Soviet Union, the Russian national water polo team became the successor of Soviet team.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1963_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1963 Summer Universiade in Porto Alegre, Brazil.
/wiki/Brazil_men%27s_national_water_polo: The Brazil men's national water polo team represents Brazil in international men's water polo competitions and friendly matches.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1965_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1965 Summer Universiade in Budapest, Hungary.
/wiki/Romania_men%27s_national_water_pol: The Romania men's national water polo team is the representative for Romania in international men's water polo.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1967_Summer_Univ: Water polo was contested for men only at the 1967 Summer Universiade in Tokyo, Japan.
/wiki/Japan_men%27s_national_water_polo_: The Japan men's national water polo team is the representative for Japan in international men's water polo.
/wiki/United_States_men%27s_national_wat: The United States men's national water polo team is the representative for the United States of America in international men's water polo.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1970_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1970 Summer Universiade in Turin, Italy.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1973_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1973 Summer Universiade in Moscow, Soviet Union.
/wiki/Cuba_men%27s_national_water_polo_t: The Cuba men's national water polo team is the representative for Cuba in international men's water polo.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1977_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1977 Summer Universiade in Sofia, Bulgaria.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1979_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1979 Summer Universiade in Mexico City, Mexico.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1981_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1981 Summer Universiade in Bucharest, Romania.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1983_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1983 Summer Universiade in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1985_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1985 Summer Universiade in Kobe, Japan.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1987_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1987 Summer Universiade in Zagreb, Yugoslavia.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1991_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1991 Summer Universiade in Sheffield, England.
/wiki/China_men%27s_national_water_polo_: The China men's national water polo team represents China in international water polo competitions and friendly matches. It is one of the leading teams in Asia.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1993_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1993 Summer Universiade in Buffalo, New York, USA.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1995_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1995 Summer Universiade in Fukuoka, Japan.
/wiki/Australia_men%27s_national_water_p: The Australian national water polo team represents Australia in men's international water polo competitions and is controlled by Australian Water Polo Inc. The national men's team has the nickname of "The Sharks". It is organised into the Asia/Oceania regional group.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1997_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1997 Summer Universiade in the island of Sicily, Italy.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_1999_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 1999 Summer Universiade in Palma de Mallorca, Spain.
/wiki/Spain_men%27s_national_water_polo_: The Spain men's national water polo team represents Spain in men's international water polo competitions and it is controlled by Real Federación Española de Natación.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_2001_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 2001 Summer Universiade in Beijing, China.
/wiki/Russia_men%27s_national_water_polo: The Russia men's national water polo team is the representative for Russia in international men's water polo. The team is a successor of the Soviet water polo team.
/wiki/Water_polo_at_the_2003_Summer_Univ: Water polo events were contested at the 2003 Summer Universiade in Daegu, South Korea.
/wiki/Serbia_and_Montenegro_men%27s_nati: The Serbia men's national water polo team represents Serbia in international water polo competitions and is controlled by the Water Polo Association of Serbia. They have won gold medals in the Olympics, World and European Championships, World Cup, FINA World League, Mediterranean Games and Universiade, making them one of the most successful men's water polo teams in the world.
